list_definition.definition: to divide (eg lines or roads) by cutting or crossing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The line AB intersects the line CD at X
Where do the two roads intersect?

list_ex_of_english: The non-linearity of the problem may lead to mutually intersecting characteristics and hence to admissible shocks.
Entities that can fulfill two or more specifications are found by intersecting the sets of entities that meet each specification individually.
The measuring volume is formed in the far field of intersecting highly directional piezoelectric transducers.
In the figure the nodes at which partitionings have been intersected are drawn with thicker lines.
Where the magnetic field intersects a material surface, there are other possibilities.
Two or more annotations cross-over one another if they are linked to intersecting regions of the document.
An equivalent process is represented by intersecting right bisecting lines of two sides of the projected triangle.
A first point of mention is that two intersecting cells were phonologically impossible.
